meanings.definition: To face with stone, concrete, or other material to prevent erosion.
meanings.sent1: The workers will revet the riverbank to stop it from washing away.
meanings.sent2: It is important to revet the coastline to protect it from erosion.
meanings.sent3: The clever beavers decided to revet their dam with sturdy rocks.
meanings.sent4: She reveted her heart with a strong barrier after the painful breakup.
meanings.sent5: The ancient castle was reveted with massive stones to withstand attacks.

meanings.definition: A facing of stone, concrete, etc., to prevent erosion.
meanings.sent1: The revet along the cliff helped prevent landslides.
meanings.sent2: The revet on the bridge kept the structure stable during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel used a tiny revet of pebbles to protect its acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: The revet of the fortress walls stood strong against the enemy's siege.
meanings.sent5: The revet of the dam was a beautiful display of craftsmanship and functionality.
